bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 182 (Friday, October 23, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. JACOBS:H.R. 8666.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following: This bill is enacted pursuant to the powergranted to the Constitution under Article I, Section 8,Clause 3 of the United States Constitution.[Page H5706]

item.title: Denying Chinese Investors Access to U.S. Small Business Aid Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

item.title: Preventing SBA Assistance from Going to China Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

item.title: Preventing SBA Assistance from Going to China Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

summary.text:
No Small Business Aid for China Act

This bill prohibits the Small Business Administration from providing aid, counsel, or assistance to a small business concern that (1) is headquartered in China, (2) has more than 25% of voting stock owned by affiliates that are citizens of or organized under the laws of China, or (3) is known to be associated with human rights violations that have occurred in Xinjiang Province, China.

bill.title: No Small Business Aid for China Act

item.title: No Small Business Aid for China Act
No Small Business Aid for China Act
To prohibit certain business concerns from receiving assistance from the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
